intro: Hoya neocaledonica, commonly known as the Caldecott hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is a popular houseplant due to its ability to thrive in low light conditions and its attractive foliage. Hoya neocaledonica is also valued for its slow growth and ease of care, making it a favorite among indoor gardeners.
